algorithm_technique: Sort both arrays. Calculate cost of direct element-wise changes. Compare with cost of sorting + element-wise changes.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum cost to make two arrays identical using element changes and subarray rearrangements.
problem_summary_technical: Compare cost of direct element-wise changes with cost of sorting + element-wise changes, considering rearrangement cost.
key_insights: The optimal strategy involves either direct element-wise transformation or sorting and then transforming.
The cost of rearranging subarrays is a fixed cost 'k'.
Sorting the arrays allows us to match elements optimally if rearrangement is used.
